intro: Tetrastigma sichouense var. sichouense, commonly known as the Sichuan grapevine, is a climbing vine native to China. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its tendrils and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
